Heading: Alerts
Keywords: Alerts Simple Example Alert Classes Functions Function Arguments Settings

IndexItems.Heading: Simple Example
IndexItems.TextContent: The following example shows how to use alerts. NOTE: Component instance properties are optional and can be omitted if the default settings are acceptable.

IndexItems.Heading: Alert Classes
IndexItems.TextContent: The alert classes available are described below.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
- alert-container The element used to contain all component generated alerts.
- alert Defines an alert
- alert-cancel-button Defines an close button that will close an alert when selected.
alert-success, alert-success-* alert-success alert-success-icon alert-success-outline Used to implement an alert success theme.
alert-info, alert-info-* alert-info alert-info-icon alert-info-outline Used to implement an alert info theme.
alert-warning, alert-warning-* alert-warning alert-warning-icon alert-warning-outline Used to implement an alert warning theme.
alert-danger, alert-danger-* alert-danger alert-danger-icon alert-danger-outline Used to implement an alert danger theme.

IndexItems.Heading: Functions
IndexItems.TextContent: WebUI provides a set of standard JavaScript alert functions for displaying alerts - this means you don't have to write any HTML.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
showAlert(message, type, auto, icon, close) Shows an alert.
showSuccessAlert(message, auto, icon, close) Shows an alert styled in the success theme.
showInfoAlert(message, auto, icon, close) Shows an alert styled in the info theme.
showWarningAlert(message, auto, icon, close) Shows an alert styled in the warning theme.
showDangerAlert(message, auto, icon, close) Shows an alert styled in the danger theme.
hideAlert(alert) Hides an alert.
update(newSettings) Updates the alert container instance at runtime using the configuration settings.
IndexItems.DataContent:
showAlert(message, type, auto, icon, close)
          Shows an alert.
        
          showSuccessAlert(message, auto, icon, close)
          Shows an alert styled in the success theme.
        
          showInfoAlert(message, auto, icon, close)
          Shows an alert styled in the info theme.
        
          showWarningAlert(message, auto, icon, close)
          Shows an alert styled in the warning theme.
        
          showDangerAlert(message, auto, icon, close)
          Shows an alert styled in the danger theme.
        
          hideAlert(alert)
          Hides an alert.
        
          update(newSettings)
          Updates the alert container instance at runtime using the configuration settings.

IndexItems.Heading: Settings
IndexItems.TextContent: Javascript settings available for the alert control.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
autoHide Whether to hide the alert automatically using the duration and transition settings.Can be true or false. Default: true.
displayOrder The order in which the alerts are stacked.Can be either "ascending" or "descending". Default: "ascending".
duration The amount of time in milliseconds that the alert is visible.An integer value. Default: 3000
inline Whether the header including the icon and close button is collapsed inline with the message.Can be true or false. Default: true.
position The initial starting position of the alert batch. Can be "top-left", "top-center", "top-right", "bottom-left", "bottom-center", or "bottom-right". Default: "top-right".
showClose Whether to show a close button.Can be true or false. Default: true.
showHeader Whether the header including the icon and close button is shown.Can be true or false. Default: true.
showIcon Whether to show an icon corresponding to the type argument specified.Can be true or false. Default: true.
style The basic alert style.Can be "outline-square", "ouline-rounded", "solid-square", "solid-rounded". Default: "outline-square".
transitionDuration The time taken in milliseconds for the alert to fade in and out.An integer value. Default: 300.
width The initial width of the alert container as a CSS string value, e.g. "60rem".Default: "25rem".

IndexItems.Heading: Alert Customisation
IndexItems.TextContent: Alerts can also be written inline using markup. Any of the WebUI styles and JavaScript functions can be used to create the style and behaviour required. NOTE: Because manually created custom alerts are not controlled by the alert container additional JavaScript is required to close the alert.

Heading: Component Updates
Keywords: Component Updates Run-time Alert Updates Functions Function Arguments

IndexItems.Heading: Run-time Alert Updates
IndexItems.TextContent: Settings specified for the alertControl instance can be updated programatically at run-time. See the following example, which updates the position and displayOrder settings.

IndexItems.Heading: Functions
IndexItems.TextContent: WebUI provides a single function that can be used to update the alert instance settings at runtime.
IndexItems.HtmlContent: update(newSettings) Updates the alert instance at runtime using the configuration settings.
IndexItems.DataContent:
update(newSettings)
          Updates the alert instance at runtime using the configuration settings.

IndexItems.Heading: Alert Event Callbacks
IndexItems.TextContent: There are 4 event callbacks that can be used, ui.alert.show.before, ui.alert.show.after, ui.alert.hide.before, and ui.alert.hide.after. NOTE: If custom alerts are created and controlled outside the alert container, as in the example above, the following events are not triggered.

IndexItems.TextContent: In order to align images or other inline media elements such as video you should use the align-media-* classes.

IndexItems.Heading: Float Alignment
IndexItems.TextContent: A set of classes using float alignment are available as follows: The float-left and float-right classes use float: left and float: right CSS styles. NOTE: It's a good idea to use the container class on any parent wrapper element, so that its border edge is cleared to below any floated elements. The standard container uses a clearfix method. IndexItems.Heading: Build Steps
IndexItems.TextContent: The NPM package manager requires node to be installed first. You will need Node 18.x or later. The latest version can be downloaded here Node Download NPM is installed by the Node installer. This will install the latest NPM globally. For more information see NPM installation docs here NPM Installation Now you are ready to set up the WebUI project. Start by downloading and unpacking the latest WebUI version or fork the WebUI GitHub repository to your chosen project folder. Open a command prompt and navigate to the project folder where you unpacked the WebUI project files. Type the following and wait for dependencies to be installed. This will install all packages listed in the package.json file, including WebUI. To build the project for development, type the following: To build the project for production, type the following:

Heading: Changing SASS Theme Files
Keywords: Changing SASS Theme Files Theme Files

IndexItems.Heading: Theme Files
IndexItems.TextContent: Most of the theme colors are used throughout the framework and have been carefully grouped in theme sets. Any colors can be chosen, but contrast and accessibility should be kept in mind. Currently, the HSL theme file is used in the build by default. When the project is built the theme colors will be converted to HEX during the minification process, but the un-minified versions will retain either HSL or RGB color values. For more information on themes see the Colors section.

IndexItems.Heading: Breakpoints
IndexItems.TextContent: Breakpoint settings are found in 2 separate files that must match in terms of the breakpoint sizes. The 2 files are _settings.scss and _settings.js. NOTE: The 'under' and 'over' values for each breakpoint pair must be as close to each other as possible because not all browsers round to the nearest whole pixel. A difference of 0.01rem or 0. For more information on breakpoints see the Breakpoints section.

IndexItems.Heading: Button Styling
IndexItems.TextContent: The simplest way to style buttons is to use 2 classes - one to set the button size, and another to set the button color. NOTE: Nav buttons cannot be styled this way, but must be initialised with the required colors using the JavaScript configuration. All buttons can be enhanced by adding the feedback-* classes. For more information about feedback classes, see the User Feedback Classes section.

Heading: Default Buttons
Keywords: Default Buttons Standard Buttons Button Links

IndexItems.Heading: Standard Buttons
IndexItems.TextContent: The standard button is a natural choice for use in forms, but it can be used anywhere. Unlike menu buttons and view buttons, the width will adjust according to the button content.

IndexItems.Heading: Button Links
IndexItems.TextContent: Button links are similar to buttons in that they do not stretch to the width of their containing element, but only expand to their content with some padding.

Heading: Menu Buttons
Keywords: Menu Buttons Standard Menu Buttons Menu Button Links

IndexItems.Heading: Standard Menu Buttons
IndexItems.TextContent: Menu buttons are primarily used for menus, and come in only 3 sizes (Un-sized, small, and large). The tool-bar-* classes can be used to fix the height of an element to match menu button heights. Toolbars are available in 3 sizes (un-sized, small , and large). Menu buttons can also be arranged vertically and will expand to the width of the containing element.

IndexItems.Heading: Menu Button Links
IndexItems.TextContent: Menu button links are similar to menu buttons in that they stretch to the full width of their containing element.

Heading: View Buttons
Keywords: View Buttons View Buttons View Button Links

IndexItems.Heading: View Buttons
IndexItems.TextContent: View buttons are similar to menu buttons in behaviour, but do not have a colored background by default. View buttons can also be arranged vertically and will expand to the width of the containing element.

IndexItems.Heading: View Button Links
IndexItems.TextContent: View button links are similar to view buttons in that they stretch to the full width of their containing element.

IndexItems.Heading: Nav Buttons
IndexItems.TextContent: Nav buttons are designed to be used with the Navbar component, but can also be used independantly for other purposes.

Heading: Carousel
Keywords: Carousel Simple Example Classes Functions Function Arguments Settings

IndexItems.Heading: Simple Example
IndexItems.TextContent: The following example shows how to set up a simple carousel with ability to start / stop and navigate to the previous and next slides.

IndexItems.Heading: Classes
IndexItems.TextContent: The following classes are use to set up the basic carousel structure.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
carousel Defines the carousel control context.
carousel-item-holder Defines the container that will hold carousel items or slides.
carousel-item Defines a carousel slide.
IndexItems.DataContent:
carousel
          Defines the carousel control context.
        
          carousel-item-holder
          Defines the container that will hold carousel items or slides.
        
          carousel-item
          Defines a carousel slide.

IndexItems.Heading: Functions
IndexItems.TextContent: WebUI provides a set of standard JavaScript carousel functions for operating carousels. The behaviour is controlled by the JavaScript initialisation as shown in the examples. Functions used to operate the carousel.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
prev() Moves the carousel to the previous slide.
next() Moves the carousel to the next slide.
select(index) Moves the carousel to the slide corresponding to the specified index.
play() Starts the automatic slide transition sequence.
stop() Stops the automatic slide transition sequence.
playDirection(direction) Updates the carousel auto play direction.
playInterval(interval) Updates the carousel auto play interval between slides.
IndexItems.DataContent:
prev()
          Moves the carousel to the previous slide.
        
          next()
          Moves the carousel to the next slide.
        
          select(index)
          Moves the carousel to the slide corresponding to the specified index.
        
          play()
          Starts the automatic slide transition sequence.
        
          stop()
          Stops the automatic slide transition sequence.
        
          playDirection(direction)
          Updates the carousel auto play direction.
        
          playInterval(interval)
          Updates the carousel auto play interval between slides.

IndexItems.Heading: Function Arguments
IndexItems.TextContent: Function arguments for selecting slides and updating play characteristics.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
index A zero based integer value representing a slide index.
direction The direction as a string value. Can be either "next" or "prev".
interval An integer value representing the interval in milliseconds.
IndexItems.DataContent:
index
          A zero based integer value representing a slide index.
        
          direction
          The direction as a string value. Can be either "next" or "prev".
        
          interval
          An integer value representing the interval in milliseconds.

IndexItems.Heading: Settings
IndexItems.TextContent: Javascript settings available for the carousel control.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
autoPlay Whether the carousel will automatically play slides on page load.Can be true or false. Default: true
autoScale Whether the carousel will maintain the original image aspect ratio when the carousel scales with the viewport.Can be true or false. Default: true
playDirection Whether the carousel will play forwards or backwards through the slides.Can be "next" or "prev". Default: "next"
playInterval The amount of time in milliseconds between each slide transition.An integer value. Default: 10000
stopOnHover Whether the carousel will pause when the mouse pointer is over the carousel.Can be true or false. Default: true.
transitionDuration The amount of time in milliseconds taken to complete each slide transition.An integer value. Default: 1000
transitionType The type of transition used when changing to a new slide.Can be "slide", "fade", or "crossfade". Default: "slide".
transitionOrientation The direction of the transition.Can be "vertical" or "horizontal". Default: "horizontal".
width The width of the carousel. Ignored if autoScale is true. Default: true.Can be any valid CSS width value.
height The height of the carousel. Ignored if autoScale is true. Default: true.Can be any valid CSS height value.
IndexItems.DataContent:
autoPlay
          Whether the carousel will automatically play slides on page load.Can be true or false. Default: true
        
          autoScale
          Whether the carousel will maintain the original image aspect ratio when the carousel scales with the viewport.Can be true or false. Default: true
        
          playDirection
          Whether the carousel will play forwards or backwards through the slides.Can be "next" or "prev". Default: "next"
        
          playInterval
          The amount of time in milliseconds between each slide transition.An integer value. Default: 10000
        
          stopOnHover
          Whether the carousel will pause when the mouse pointer is over the carousel.Can be true or false. Default: true.

Heading: Flexbox
Keywords: Flexbox Basic Concepts Simple Flexbox Examples

IndexItems.Heading: Basic Concepts
IndexItems.TextContent: Flexbox was designed to improve the arrangement and layout of content whatever the size or quantity, but was never intended to be a replacement for grid systems, and can be introduced to existin... So how does it work? Flexbox is designed around the idea of a flex container (the parent element) and flex items (the child elements). WebUI supports the full range of flexbox features providing a comprehensive set of utility classes, including media breakpoint specific equivalents. A set of flex item sizing classes (1 - 24) are also available. To support layouts generally, WebUI includes a comprehensive set of layout property classes for alignment, justification, spacing and padding.

IndexItems.Heading: Simple Flexbox Examples
IndexItems.TextContent: The examples below show how to make very simple structures using flexbox classes. Another way to do a similar thing is by using the high level classes such as flex-container and flex-col.

Heading: Flexbox Classes
Keywords: Flexbox Classes High-Level Classes High-Level Class Examples Shortcut Classes Shortcut Class Examples Using layout property classes for spacing

IndexItems.Heading: High-Level Classes
IndexItems.TextContent: WebUI includes a set of high level flexbox classes that also set other default styles. The flex-container class does not have to be used, since it is provided for convenience only. It defines a couple of defaults, such as display type flex and relative positioning. NOTE: Any of the following classes can be used as a flex container, depending on your requirements.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
flex-container Defines a flexbox container with relative positioning. Child elements are not wrapped or constrained.
flex-row Defines a flexbox row. Child elements are wrapped when they cannot fit within the width of a single row.
flex-row-reverse Similar to flex-row, but flex items are displayed in reverse order.
flex-col Defines a flexbox column. Child elements are not wrapped.
flex-col-reverse Similar to flex-col, but flex items are displayed in reverse order.

IndexItems.Heading: Control Classes
IndexItems.TextContent: Control classes used for default, validation and highlight styling. The control class is useful when form controls such as textareas or selects need to match the appearance of other controls. When using a control-success, control-info, control-warning or control-danger class on textboxes or buttons a corresponding icon is added automatically. Any form controls where specific classes are not available require the control class in order to use control-[theme] and instrumentation classes. See the following example.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
control Styles an element to the default form control color and padding style.
control-success Styles an element to the theme success style. Textboxes and buttons will automatically show a check icon.
control-info Styles an element to the theme info style. Textboxes and buttons will automatically show an info icon.
control-warning Styles an element to the theme warning style. Textboxes and buttons will automatically show a warning icon.
control-danger Styles an element to the theme danger style. Textboxes and buttons will automatically show a danger icon.
control-highlight Styles an element to the theme highlight style.
control-disabled Styles an element to the theme disabled style.
control-message Sets the visibility of an element to hidden. This class is used in form validation functions.

Heading: Installation
Keywords: Installation Simple Method Using a CDN NPM Yarn NuGet LibMan

IndexItems.Heading: Using a CDN
IndexItems.TextContent: If you prefer not to download the full package and just want to try it out, then this can be done by linking to the required files on a CDN as follows.

IndexItems.Heading: NPM
IndexItems.TextContent: This is the recommended way to install WebUI if you are building websites using popular frameworks such as Angular, React, or Vue.

IndexItems.Heading: Yarn
IndexItems.TextContent: Alternatively, you can use Yarn to install the WebUI packages.

IndexItems.Heading: NuGet
IndexItems.TextContent: If you are using Visual Studio before VS2019 to develop websites, then this is the preferred way to install WebUI.

IndexItems.Heading: LibMan
IndexItems.TextContent: If you are using Visual Studio 2019 or later, then the built-in "LibMan" utility is the best way to manage client-side libraries. LibMan documentation

Heading: What's Included?
Keywords: What's Included? NPM Yarn NuGet GitHub Download

IndexItems.Heading: NPM
IndexItems.TextContent: The NPM package includes the WebUI source files and the minified and development distribution files.

IndexItems.Heading: Yarn
IndexItems.TextContent: Yarn installs the same package as with NPM, but may be better suited to certain projects or environments.

IndexItems.Heading: NuGet
IndexItems.TextContent: The NuGet package includes only the minified and development distribution files.

IndexItems.Heading: GitHub Download
IndexItems.TextContent: The GitHub download includes all WebUI files for the framework, docs website, demo pages, and build files.

Heading: Accessibility
Keywords: Accessibility Accessibility Focus Ring Accessibility Classes ARIA Attributes Keyboard Navigation Color Contrast

IndexItems.Heading: Accessibility Focus Ring
IndexItems.TextContent: WebUI provides the accessibility-* classes to increase the visibility of form controls. This behaviour relates to control focus events. Adding an accessibility-* class to a parent element will cause all focusable child controls to show a focus ring when tabbed to or gaining focus.

IndexItems.Heading: Accessibility Classes
IndexItems.TextContent: List of accessibility classes available.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
accessibility Adds a focus ring to focusable elements when receiving focus, and in the default theme color.
accessibility-light Adds a focus ring to focusable elements when receiving focus, and in the light theme color.
accessibility-dark Adds a focus ring to focusable elements when receiving focus, and in the dark theme color.
accessibility-accent-1 Adds a focus ring to focusable elements when receiving focus, and in the accent-1 theme color.
accessibility-accent-2 Adds a focus ring to focusable elements when receiving focus, and in the accent-2 theme color.
accessibility-accent-3 Adds a focus ring to focusable elements when receiving focus, and in the accent-3 theme color.

Heading: Grid System
Keywords: Grid System Basic Concepts Layout Grid classes Simple rows and columns Simple rows and columns with fixed size content Rows with columns shortcut Rows with responsive columns shortcut Combining columns and fixed columns Sized columns Simple rows and responsive columns Rows with multiple breakpoint responsive columns

IndexItems.Heading: Basic Concepts
IndexItems.TextContent: WebUI uses a 24 column flexbox grid system to create layouts. Each row can contain up to 24 columns, and each column can contain any other content. The grid system is one of many tools that can be used for layouts and is provided for convenience - it is built on top of flexbox and combined with other complimentary features. To support layouts generally, WebUI includes a comprehensive set of layout property classes for alignment, justification, spacing and padding.

IndexItems.Heading: Layout Grid classes
IndexItems.TextContent: Classes available for the layout grid.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
row Defines a layout grid row and initialise immediate child elements to 100% width.
row-inline Defines a layout grid inline row and initialise immediate child elements to 100% width.
cols Used to initialise immediate child elements as layout grid default columns.
cols-fixed Used to initialise immediate child elements as layout grid fixed columns.
col Defines a layout grid default column.
col-fixed Defines a layout grid fixed column.
col-[proportion] Defines a column of the specified proportion of the row width (1 - 24), e.g. col-4, col-16, col-24.

IndexItems.Heading: Container Classes
IndexItems.TextContent: WebUI has 4 container types available which can be used for a default context for any child elements. Each has useful defaults.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
container Defines a block level container with relative positioning. It is also suitable for containing floated elements.
flex-container Defines a flexbox container with relative positioning. Child elements are not wrapped or constrained.
grid-container Defines a grid container with relative positioning.
media-container-* Defines a container with aspect ratio. (See the Media Container section.)
IndexItems.DataContent:
container
          Defines a block level container with relative positioning. It is also suitable for containing floated elements.
        
          flex-container
          Defines a flexbox container with relative positioning. Child elements are not wrapped or constrained.
        
          grid-container
          Defines a grid container with relative positioning.
        
          media-container-*
          Defines a container with aspect ratio. (See the Media Container section.)

IndexItems.Heading: All-purpose container
IndexItems.TextContent: This container type can be used wherever a relative positioning context is required as well as ensuring that any floated elements will be properly accomodated. In the second example below, the container class ensures that an elements border edge is moved down to clear any of its floated child elements. NOTE: You can use containers even if you don't plan to use floated elements.

IndexItems.Heading: Flex container
IndexItems.TextContent: The flex-container is used to create an area of the document for flexbox layouts. It sets the display property to flex, causing all immediate child elements to become flex items. A simple flex container example is shown below.

IndexItems.Heading: Grid container
IndexItems.TextContent: The grid-container is used for a convenient way to define a starting point for any grid layout. It also sets a relative positioning context. A simple grid container example is shown below.

IndexItems.Heading: Breakpoint Examples
IndexItems.TextContent: In this example, a button is only hidden at breakpoint 3 and under. Because WebUI implements breakpoints for minimum media sizes as well as maximum media sizes, utility classes can be combined to produce responsive behaviour within a range. There can be situations where a change in the order of flex items between two breakpoints is required.

IndexItems.TextContent: The presence of a menu activator class causes an element such as a button or link to become a trigger for opening and closing dropdown menus. There are 3 types of activator.

menu-activator-focus Toggles the corresponding dropdown on focus and blur.
menu-activator-hover Toggles the corresponding dropdown on hover in and hover out.

          Toggles the corresponding dropdown on hover in and hover out.

dropdown-content-expand Defines an in document flow element that will contain dropdown menu items, such as buttons or links.
dropdown-sheet Defines a full width out of document flow element that will contain dropdown menu items, such as buttons or links.
dropdown-right Causes the dropdown to be orientated from right to left.

IndexItems.Heading: Menu Item Classes

menu-close Causes the parent dropdown to close when any menu item button or link is activated.

          Defines the modal container and backdrop.
        
          modal-close
          Specifies that the control will close the modal when activated.
        
          modal-scroll-body
          A container to wrap modal content and allow vertical scrolling without a scrollbar.

IndexItems.Heading: Sizing Classes
IndexItems.TextContent: The modal sizing classes are described below.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
model-sm Specifies a small sized modal.
modal-md Specifies a medium sized modal.
modal-lg Specifies a large sized modal.
modal-full Specifies a full screen modal.
modal-unsized Specifies a modal that is sized according to its content. (Suitable for basic lightbox functionality).
modal-auto-stretch Causes the modal height to stretch on small device viewports.
IndexItems.DataContent:

          Specifies a full screen modal.
        
          modal-unsized
          Specifies a modal that is sized according to its content. (Suitable for basic lightbox functionality).
        
          modal-auto-stretch
          Causes the modal height to stretch on small device viewports.

IndexItems.Heading: Positioning Classes
IndexItems.TextContent: NOTE: The default modal position is at the absolute center of the viewport unless the modal-unsized class is also used.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
modal-top-left Positions the modal at the top left of the viewport.
modal-top-center Positions the modal at the top center of the viewport.
modal-top-right Positions the modal at the top right of the viewport.
modal-middle-left Positions the modal at the middle left of the viewport.
modal-middle-center Positions the modal at the absolute center of the viewport. (Only required when modal-unsized class is also used).
modal-middle-right Positions the modal at the middle right of the viewport.
modal-bottom-left Positions the modal at the bottom left of the viewport.
modal-bottom-center Positions the modal at the bottom center of the viewport.
modal-bottom-right Positions the modal at the bottom right of the viewport.

IndexItems.Heading: Modal Functions
IndexItems.TextContent: The functions available for modals are described below. Modals can be closed by using the Esc key.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
open() Shows a modal.
close() Closes a modal.
update(newSettings) Updates the modal instance at runtime using the configuration settings.
IndexItems.DataContent:
open()
          Shows a modal.
        
          close()
          Closes a modal.
        
          update(newSettings)
          Updates the modal instance at runtime using the configuration settings.

IndexItems.Heading: Settings
IndexItems.TextContent: Javascript settings available for the modal control.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
closeFromBackdrop Whether to allow the modal to be dismissed by clicking outside the modal.Can be true or false. Default: false.
disablePageScrolling Whether to disable page scrolling while the modal is open. Default: true.
focusElement The element or control to receive focus when the modal is opened. Default: null.
focusReturnElement The element or control to receive focus when the modal is closed. Default: null.
transitionDuration The time taken in milliseconds for the modal to fade in and out.An integer value. Default: 300.
IndexItems.DataContent:
closeFromBackdrop
          Whether to allow the modal to be dismissed by clicking outside the modal.Can be true or false. Default: false.
        
          disablePageScrolling
          Whether to disable page scrolling while the modal is open. Default: true.
        
          focusElement
          The element or control to receive focus when the modal is opened. Default: null.
        
          focusReturnElement
          The element or control to receive focus when the modal is closed. Default: null.
        
          transitionDuration
          The time taken in milliseconds for the modal to fade in and out.An integer value. Default: 300.

IndexItems.Heading: Displaying Images
IndexItems.TextContent: Modals can also be used for displaying images. Use the modal-unsized class inner modal box to ensure the image always fits the modal window exactly while maintaining the original aspect ratio.

Heading: Component Update

IndexItems.Heading: Run-time Modal Updates
IndexItems.TextContent: Settings specified for the modalControl instance can be updated programatically at run-time.

IndexItems.Heading: Functions
IndexItems.TextContent: WebUI provides a single function that can be used to update the modal instance settings at runtime.
IndexItems.HtmlContent: update(newSettings) Updates the modal instance at runtime using the configuration settings.
IndexItems.DataContent:
update(newSettings)
          Updates the modal instance at runtime using the configuration settings.

IndexItems.Heading: Modal Event Callbacks
IndexItems.TextContent: There are 4 event callbacks that can be used, ui.modal.show.before, ui.modal.show.after, ui.modal.hide.before, and ui.modal.hide.after.

IndexItems.TextContent: This example uses buttons for the top level menu activation, which means the navbar will add an active class to the currently selected button and therefore change the styling.

IndexItems.Heading: Navbar Classes

nav-lg Applied to the wrapper element for a large navbar component.
nav-logo Applied to a navbar element containing a navbar logo.
nav-item Applied to the menu items within a menu dropdown.
nav-component Applied to a navbar element containing a custom control.
nav-toggle Applied to a navbar element containing a small device toggle button.
nav-menu Applied to the navbar element forming a menu dropdown.
nav-sub-menu Applied to the navbar element forming a sub menu dropdown.
nav-content Can be added to the nav-sub-menu or its children to enable free-form content.
nav-reverse Used to reverse the positions of navbar logo and nav button elements.
nav-activator Toggles the corresponding menu dropdown when clicked.

IndexItems.Heading: Nav Indicator Classes
IndexItems.TextContent: Classes available for nav indicators.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
nav-indicator Defines a nav indicator with a starting orientation pointing down.
nav-indicator-left Defines a nav indicator with a starting orientation pointing right.
nav-indicator-right Defines a nav indicator with a starting orientation pointing left.
nav-indicator-up Defines a nav indicator with a starting orientation pointing up.
active Rotates the nav indicator when applied.

          Rotates the nav indicator when applied.

IndexItems.Heading: Settings
IndexItems.TextContent: Javascript settings available for the nav indicator control.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
indicatorType Sets the indicator style.Can be "arrow", "caret" or "chevron". Default: "caret".
indicatorSize Sets the indicator size.Can be either "small", "medium" or "large". Default: "medium".
backgroundColor Sets the background behind the SVG indicator element. Default: "transparent"
color Sets the SVG indicator color. Default: "#000000".
transitionDuration The duration in milliseconds for the nav indicator rotation. Default: 500

IndexItems.Heading: Snap Positioning
IndexItems.TextContent: If more granular positioning is required, then WebUI provides the snap positioning JavaScript utility function that can be used to accurately position elements relative to any other element. The following example shows a second shape being positioned relative to the top left corner of the first shape's original border edge.

IndexItems.Heading: Positioning Utility Classes
IndexItems.TextContent: The following utility classes are provided for further flexibility.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
relative Sets the positioning of an element to relative.
fixed Sets the positioning of an element to fixed.
absolute Sets the positioning of an element to absolute.
sticky Sets the positioning of an element to sticky.
IndexItems.DataContent:
relative
          Sets the positioning of an element to relative.
        
          fixed
          Sets the positioning of an element to fixed.
        
          absolute
          Sets the positioning of an element to absolute.
        
          sticky
          Sets the positioning of an element to sticky.

IndexItems.Heading: Radial navigation (Full circle)
IndexItems.TextContent: The following example uses the createOctagonShape() function to create the radial-item shape.

IndexItems.Heading: Classes
IndexItems.TextContent: Classes available in WebUI for radial controls.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
radial Defines a container for the radial control.
radial-content Defines the content area for radial items.
radial-item Specifies that an element should be included in the radial item collection.
radial-activator Specifies the element that will toggle the radial transition.
IndexItems.DataContent:
radial
          Defines a container for the radial control.
        
          radial-content
          Defines the content area for radial items.
        
          radial-item
          Specifies that an element should be included in the radial item collection.
        
          radial-activator
          Specifies the element that will toggle the radial transition.

IndexItems.Heading: Settings
IndexItems.TextContent: Javascript settings available for the radial control.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
zoomFactor A positive decimal number that will change the spread area in relation to the size of the radial container element.
mode Defines the arc of a circle to be used by radial items. Can be set to "full", "top", or "bottom". Default: full. Setting the mode to "full" will create a full circle radial item spread. If set to "top", the spread will form an arc around the top half of the radial area. If set to "bottom", then the arc will cover the bottom half only.
responsive Specifies that the radial control width will adjust with the width of its parent element. Can be true or false. Default: true.
transitionDuration A value in milliseconds specifying the fade in and expand/shrink animation duration.
IndexItems.DataContent:
zoomFactor
          A positive decimal number that will change the spread area in relation to the size of the radial container element.
        
          mode
          Defines the arc of a circle to be used by radial items.
            Can be set to "full", "top", or "bottom". Default: full.
            Setting the mode to "full" will create a full circle radial item spread. If set to "top", the spread will form an arc around the top half of the 
            radial area. If set to "bottom", then the arc will cover the bottom half only.
        
          responsive
          Specifies that the radial control width will adjust with the width of its parent element.
            Can be true or false. Default: true.
        
          transitionDuration
          A value in milliseconds specifying the fade in and expand/shrink animation duration.

Heading: Scroll Snap
Keywords: Scroll Snap Scroll Snap Example Scroll Snap Classes Scroll Snap Align Classes

IndexItems.Heading: Scroll Snap Example
IndexItems.TextContent: The scroll-snap-* classes allow the creation of scroll anchor points within a scroll container.

IndexItems.Heading: Scroll Snap Classes
IndexItems.TextContent: Scroll snap classes available.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
scroll-snap Sets scroll snap type to proximity on both the block and the inline axis (or x and y axis).
scroll-snap-inline Sets scroll snap type to proximity on the inline axis only.
scroll-snap-block Sets scroll snap type to proximity on the block axis only.
scroll-snap-mandatory Sets scroll snap type to mandatory on both the block and the inline axis (or x and y axis).
scroll-snap-inline-mandatory Sets scroll snap type to mandatory on the inline axis only.
scroll-snap-block-mandatory Sets scroll snap type to mandatory on the block axis only.
scroll-snap-inherit Inherits the scroll snap type from the parent element.
IndexItems.DataContent:
scroll-snap
          Sets scroll snap type to proximity on both the block and the inline axis (or x and y axis).
        
          scroll-snap-inline
          Sets scroll snap type to proximity on the inline axis only.
        
          scroll-snap-block
          Sets scroll snap type to proximity on the block axis only.
        
          scroll-snap-mandatory
          Sets scroll snap type to mandatory on both the block and the inline axis (or x and y axis).
        
          scroll-snap-inline-mandatory
          Sets scroll snap type to mandatory on the inline axis only.
        
          scroll-snap-block-mandatory
          Sets scroll snap type to mandatory on the block axis only.
        
          scroll-snap-inherit
          Inherits the scroll snap type from the parent element.

IndexItems.Heading: Scroll Snap Align Classes
IndexItems.TextContent: Scroll snap align classes available.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
scroll-snap-align Causes a scroll item to align with the start or end of the scroll container depending on its proximity and container properties.
scroll-snap-align-start Causes a scroll item to align with the start of the scroll container depending on its proximity and container properties.
scroll-snap-align-center Causes a scroll item to align with the center of the scroll container depending on its proximity and container properties.
scroll-snap-align-end Causes a scroll item to align with the end of the scroll container depending on its proximity and container properties.
scroll-snap-align-inherit Causes a scroll item to inherit alignment behavior from its parent.
scroll-snap-stop Sets the scroll snap to always, so that the container cannot skip a snap position for this item.
scroll-snap-stop-inherit Sets the scroll snap to inherit, so that the item inherits scroll snap stop behavior from its parent.
IndexItems.DataContent:
scroll-snap-align
          Causes a scroll item to align with the start or end of the scroll container depending on its proximity and container properties.
        
          scroll-snap-align-start
          Causes a scroll item to align with the start of the scroll container depending on its proximity and container properties.
        
          scroll-snap-align-center
          Causes a scroll item to align with the center of the scroll container depending on its proximity and container properties.
        
          scroll-snap-align-end
          Causes a scroll item to align with the end of the scroll container depending on its proximity and container properties.
        
          scroll-snap-align-inherit
          Causes a scroll item to inherit alignment behavior from its parent.
        
          scroll-snap-stop
          Sets the scroll snap to always, so that the container cannot skip a snap position for this item.
        
          scroll-snap-stop-inherit
          Sets the scroll snap to inherit, so that the item inherits scroll snap stop behavior from its parent.

IndexItems.Heading: Scroll Behavior Classes
IndexItems.TextContent: Scroll behavior classes available.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
scroll-behavior-smooth Causes the scrolling animation of the scroll container items to appear smooth when scrolling is triggered by navigation or via the CSS Object Model.
scroll-behavior-inherit Causes the scrolling animation of the scroll container to inherit from its parent.
IndexItems.DataContent:
scroll-behavior-smooth
          Causes the scrolling animation of the scroll container items to appear smooth when scrolling is triggered by navigation or
          via the CSS Object Model.
        
          scroll-behavior-inherit
          Causes the scrolling animation of the scroll container to inherit from its parent.

Heading: Scrollspy

IndexItems.Heading: Scrollspy Example
IndexItems.TextContent: In the following example, observe the link active color change as you scroll the page up and down. Select the link to navigate to the top or bottom scrollspy targets. NOTE: The scrollspy configuration settings also includes the scrollspyCallback function, where the event argument is used to show the link target Id in an alert.

IndexItems.Heading: Scrollspy Classes
IndexItems.TextContent: There is only one class used by the scrollspy componnet.
IndexItems.HtmlContent: scrollspy Defines a scrollspy target element.
IndexItems.DataContent:
scrollspy
          Defines a scrollspy target element.

IndexItems.Heading: Data Attributes
IndexItems.TextContent: The following data attribute is used by the scrollspy control.
IndexItems.HtmlContent: data-scrollspy Specifies the target element that will be scrolled to.
IndexItems.DataContent:
data-scrollspy
          Specifies the target element that will be scrolled to.

IndexItems.Heading: Settings
IndexItems.TextContent: Javascript settings available for the scrollspy control.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
activatorSelector Specifies the CSS selector for scrollspy activators relative to the scrollspy root container element.Example: "div > div > a"
activatorActiveClass The CSS class that will be toggled on the scrollspy activator when targets are scrolled in and out of view.
activatorActiveStyle The CSS style that will be toggled on the scrollspy activator when targets are scrolled in and out of view. This setting will override properties set using activatorActiveClass.
scrollTargetClass The CSS class present on the scrollspy targets.
scrollTargetOffset The offset in pixels before a target is considered to be in view.
activatorCallback A function that will be called when a scrollspy activator is triggered.
IndexItems.DataContent:
activatorSelector
          Specifies the CSS selector for scrollspy activators relative to the scrollspy root container element.Example: "div > div > a"
        
          activatorActiveClass
          The CSS class that will be toggled on the scrollspy activator when targets are scrolled in and out of view.
        
          activatorActiveStyle
          The CSS style that will be toggled on the scrollspy activator when targets are scrolled in and out of view. This setting will override
            properties set using activatorActiveClass.
        
          scrollTargetClass
          The CSS class present on the scrollspy targets.
        
          scrollTargetOffset
          The offset in pixels before a target is considered to be in view.
        
          activatorCallback
          A function that will be called when a scrollspy activator is triggered.

IndexItems.Heading: Clipped SVG Shapes
Clipped SVG Functions
IndexItems.TextContent: The following functions can be used to generate clipped SVG shapes. A clipped SVG element is appended as a child element.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
createRhombusShape() Appends a clipped SVG rhombus shape to a WebUI element.
createRhomboidShape() Appends a clipped SVG rhomboid shape to a WebUI element.
createKiteShape() Appends a clipped SVG kite shape to a WebUI element.
createTrapezoidIsoscelesShape() Appends a clipped SVG trapezoid isosceles shape to a WebUI element.

IndexItems.Heading: Breadcumbs
IndexItems.TextContent: Breadcrumb shapes have been developed to be versatile in terms of styling, so can be used with any theme colors.

IndexItems.Heading: Breadcrumb Classes
IndexItems.TextContent: Classes available for breadcrumbs.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
breadcrumb Defines the outer breadcrumb wrapper.
breadcrumb-xs Used to create a breadcrumb with an extra small height.
breadcrumb-sm Used to create a breadcrumb with a small height.
breadcrumb-md Used to create a breadcrumb with a medium height.
breadcrumb-lg Used to create a breadcrumb with a large height.
breadcrumb-xl Used to create a breadcrumb with an extra large height.
breadcrumb-last Used by the CSS to style the last breadcrumb item.
breadcrumb-line-* Sets the color of the breadcrumb item divider lines.
breadcrumb-rounded Sets the shape of the breadcrumb item ends and divider lines to rounded.
breadcrumb-nodivider Removes the breadcrumb divider line for individual breadcrumb items.
breadcrumb-nopointer Removes the pointed or rounded end from breadcrumb items.
IndexItems.DataContent:
breadcrumb
          Defines the outer breadcrumb wrapper.
        
          breadcrumb-xs
          Used to create a breadcrumb with an extra small height.
        
          breadcrumb-sm
          Used to create a breadcrumb with a small height.
        
          breadcrumb-md
          Used to create a breadcrumb with a medium height.
        
          breadcrumb-lg
          Used to create a breadcrumb with a large height.
        
          breadcrumb-xl
          Used to create a breadcrumb with an extra large height.
        
          breadcrumb-last
          Used by the CSS to style the last breadcrumb item.
        
          breadcrumb-line-*
          Sets the color of the breadcrumb item divider lines.
        
          breadcrumb-rounded
          Sets the shape of the breadcrumb item ends and divider lines to rounded.
        
          breadcrumb-nodivider
          Removes the breadcrumb divider line for individual breadcrumb items.
        
          breadcrumb-nopointer
          Removes the pointed or rounded end from breadcrumb items.

IndexItems.Heading: Table Examples
IndexItems.TextContent: HTML tables can be styled using a few simple classes. In addition, the col-padding-* classes can be used to add padding for all table cells.

IndexItems.Heading: Table Classes
IndexItems.TextContent: HTML tables are supported with a set of high-level classes to set up the layout, style and basic theme colors. These classes are described below.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
table Defines table layout of fixed with a width of 100% and collapsed border.
table-auto Similar to the table class, but using a table layout of auto.
table-layout-auto Used to set a table layout to auto.
table-layout-fixed Used to set a table layout to fixed.
table-bordered Adds a themed border to all table data (td) cells, or a default border if no theme is defined.
table-head-bordered Adds a themed border to all table header (th) cells, or a default border if no theme is defined.
table-striped Adds a themed background color to alternate table rows (tr).
table-hover Adds a themed hover color to table rows (tr).
table-responsive When added to the table element, the table will stack at the breakpoint specified in the settings.
table-default Styles a table based on the default theme color.
table-light Styles a table based on the light theme color.
table-light-alternate Styles a table based on the light-alternate theme color.
table-dark Styles a table based on the dark theme color.
table-dark-alternate Styles a table based on the dark-alternate theme color.
table-accent-1 Styles a table based on on the accent-1 theme color.
table-accent-2 Styles a table based on the accent-2 theme color.
table-accent-3 Styles a table based on the accent-3 theme color.
table-accent-4 Styles a table based on the accent-4 theme color.
table-accent-5 Styles a table based on the accent-5 theme color.

IndexItems.Heading: Toast Message Example
IndexItems.TextContent: To create a toast message, first define a block of HTML markup to serve as a template, then point the toastItemTemplate settings property to that template. The following example shows how to set up toast messages. NOTE: Many component instance properties are optional and can be omitted if the default settings are acceptable, but toastItemTemplate must be provided.

IndexItems.Heading: Toast Classes
IndexItems.TextContent: The main toast message classes are described as follows.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
toast-container The element used to contain all component generated toast messages.
toast-item Defines a toast message.
IndexItems.DataContent:
toast-container
          The element used to contain all component generated toast messages.
        
          toast-item
          Defines a toast message.

IndexItems.Heading: Functions
IndexItems.TextContent: WebUI provides a set of standard JavaScript toast container functions. The behaviour of toast messages is controlled by the JavaScript initialisation as shown in the examples below.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
showToastItem() Shows a toast message.
update(newSettings) Updates the toast container instance at runtime using the configuration settings.
IndexItems.DataContent:
showToastItem()
          Shows a toast message.
        
          update(newSettings)
          Updates the toast container instance at runtime using the configuration settings.

IndexItems.Heading: Settings
IndexItems.TextContent: Javascript settings available for the toast control.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
autoHide Whether to hide the toast message automatically using the duration and transition settings.Can be true or false. Default: false.
displayOrder The order in which tosat messages are stacked.Can be either "ascending" or "descending". Default: "ascending".
duration The amount of time in milliseconds that the toast message is visible.An integer value. Default: 3000
position The initial starting position of the toast message batch. Can be "top-left", "top-center", "top-right", "bottom-left", "bottom-center", or "bottom-right". Default: "top-right".
toastItemTemplate The HTML markup element used as a template. Required. (The toast container will clone the template as required.)
transitionDuration The time taken in milliseconds for the toast message to fade in and out.An integer value. Default: 300.
width The initial width of the toast container as a CSS string value, e.g. "60rem".Default: "25rem".

          duration
          The amount of time in milliseconds that the toast message is visible.An integer value. Default: 3000

          The initial starting position of the toast message batch.
            Can be "top-left", "top-center", "top-right", "bottom-left", "bottom-center", or "bottom-right". Default: "top-right".

Heading: Toggle Container
Keywords: Toggle Container Basic Toggle Using toggle-activator and toggle-deactivator together Classes Data Attributes

IndexItems.Heading: Basic Toggle
IndexItems.TextContent: One very simple use for the toggle container is to toggle visibility of an element without writing any JavaScript.

IndexItems.Heading: Using toggle-activator and toggle-deactivator together
IndexItems.TextContent: Sometimes it may be useful to deactivate the element specified as the toggle item via an event on the toggle item itself. A toggle item can be a toggle activator or deactivator. In the following example, the toggle item targets itself as the deactivator.

IndexItems.Heading: Classes
IndexItems.TextContent: Classes available in WebUI for toggle container.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
toggle-container Defines a container for one or more toggle items.
toggle-item Defines a single toggle element.
toggle-item-content Defines an toggle item area where form controls will be hidden when a toggle item is hidden or moved off screen.
toggle-activator Toggles the element specified by the data target attribute via a click event.
toggle-activator-hover Toggles the element specified by the data target attribute via a hover event.
toggle-activator-focus Toggles the element specified by the data target attribute via a focus event.
toggle-deactivator Toggles the element specified by the data target attribute via a click event.
toggle-deactivator-hover Toggles the element specified by the data target attribute via a hover event.
toggle-deactivator-focus Toggles the element specified by the data target attribute via a focus event.
toggle-inclusive When present on the toggle-container, toggle items will show without sibling toggle items being hidden.
off-canvas-left Adds left off-canvas functionality to a toggle item.
off-canvas-right Adds right off-canvas functionality to a toggle item.
off-canvas-body Causes an element to shift in tandem with an off-canvas toggle item. This would normally be a page content area, but could be any element.
off-canvas-drawer Required for off-canvas toggle items that are separate from off-canvas body functionality and when the off-canvas-body class is present.
IndexItems.DataContent:
toggle-container
          Defines a container for one or more toggle items.
        
          toggle-item
          Defines a single toggle element.
        
          toggle-item-content
          Defines an toggle item area where form controls will be hidden when a toggle item is hidden or moved off screen.
        
          toggle-activator
          Toggles the element specified by the data target attribute via a click event.
        
          toggle-activator-hover
          Toggles the element specified by the data target attribute via a hover event.
        
          toggle-activator-focus
          Toggles the element specified by the data target attribute via a focus event.
        
          toggle-deactivator
          Toggles the element specified by the data target attribute via a click event.
        
          toggle-deactivator-hover
          Toggles the element specified by the data target attribute via a hover event.
        
          toggle-deactivator-focus
          Toggles the element specified by the data target attribute via a focus event.
        
          toggle-inclusive
          When present on the toggle-container, toggle items will show without sibling toggle items being hidden.
        
          off-canvas-left
          Adds left off-canvas functionality to a toggle item.
        
          off-canvas-right
          Adds right off-canvas functionality to a toggle item.
        
          off-canvas-body
          Causes an element to shift in tandem with an off-canvas toggle item. This would normally be a page content area, but could be any element.
        
          off-canvas-drawer
          Required for off-canvas toggle items that are separate from off-canvas body functionality and when the off-canvas-body class is present.

IndexItems.Heading: Data Attributes
IndexItems.TextContent: Data attributes available in WebUI for toggle container.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
data-target Specifies an element that will be toggled by a toggle activator.
data-transition-duration The time taken in milliseconds for the toggle item to transition in and out.An integer value. Default: 500.
data-transition-type The transition type used to toggle a toggle item in and out.Can be "slide", "fade" or "collapse". Default: slide.
data-transition-orientation The transition orientation used to toggle a toggle item in and out.Can be "vertical" or "horizontal". Default: horizontal.
data-transition-distance The transition distance used to toggle a toggle item in and out.Can be rem, px, or % units. Default: Content width.
data-close-external A valid CSS selector for the toggle item(s) that will be hidden by clicking anywhere outside the specified toggle item(s).Default: Not enabled.
data-allow-escape-key Allows the escape key to be used to dismiss a toggled element.Can be "true" or "false". Default: false.
data-focus-element Specifies a control to receive focus when a toggle item is shown or moved into view.The id of an element, e.g. #myElem
data-focus-return-element Specifies a control to receive focus when a toggle item is hidden or moved out of view.The id of an element, e.g. #myElem

IndexItems.Heading: Tooltip resizing and positioning
IndexItems.TextContent: Tooltips use viewport boundary collision detection to attempt to avoid the possibility of being placed off screen or partially off screen.

IndexItems.Heading: Tooltip Type Classes
IndexItems.TextContent: One of the following tooltip type classes must be specified.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
tooltip-hover Causes the tooltip to show while hovering over its target control.
tooltip-focus Causes the tooltip to show on focus of its target control.
tooltip-static Use this option if you just want to show or hide tooltips manually with javascript.

IndexItems.Heading: Positioning Classes
IndexItems.TextContent: One of the following tooltip positioning classes must be specified.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
tooltip-top Initial position of the tooltip is at the top of its target control.
tooltip-left Initial position of the tooltip is to the left of its target control.
tooltip-bottom Initial position of the tooltip is at the bottom of its target control.
tooltip-right Initial position of the tooltip is to the right of its target control.
IndexItems.DataContent:
tooltip-top
          Initial position of the tooltip is at the top of its target control.
        
          tooltip-left
          Initial position of the tooltip is to the left of its target control.
        
          tooltip-bottom
          Initial position of the tooltip is at the bottom of its target control.
        
          tooltip-right
          Initial position of the tooltip is to the right of its target control.

IndexItems.Heading: Additional Classes
IndexItems.TextContent: The tooltip-close class is optional and is similar to menu-close and would normally be applied to a button or a link.
IndexItems.HtmlContent: tooltip-close When added to an element inside the tooltip container, selecting the element will close the tooltip.
IndexItems.DataContent:
tooltip-close
          When added to an element inside the tooltip container, selecting the element will close the tooltip.

IndexItems.Heading: Functions
IndexItems.TextContent: WebUI provides a set of standard JavaScript tooltip functions. The behaviour of tooltips is controlled by the JavaScript initialisation as shown in the examples below.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
showTooltip(tooltipWrapper, message) Shows a tooltip. (Required for manually showing static tooltips).
hideTooltip(tooltipWrapper) Hides a tooltip. (Required for manually hiding static tooltips).
update(newSettings) Updates the tooltip instance at runtime using the configuration settings.
IndexItems.DataContent:
showTooltip(tooltipWrapper, message)
          Shows a tooltip. (Required for manually showing static tooltips).
        
          hideTooltip(tooltipWrapper)
          Hides a tooltip. (Required for manually hiding static tooltips).
        
          update(newSettings)
          Updates the tooltip instance at runtime using the configuration settings.

IndexItems.Heading: Function Arguments
IndexItems.TextContent: The purpose of each tooltip function argument.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
tooltipWrapper The outermost tooltip element with a class of tooltip.
message The string or HTML message to be shown in a tooltip.
newSettings An object literal containing a comma separated list of settings.
IndexItems.DataContent:
tooltipWrapper
          The outermost tooltip element with a class of tooltip.
        
          message
          The string or HTML message to be shown in a tooltip.
        
          newSettings
          An object literal containing a comma separated list of settings.

IndexItems.Heading: Settings
IndexItems.TextContent: Javascript settings available for the tooltips control.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
autoPositioning Sets the automatic repositioning behaviour of tooltips. Default: true.
autoResizing Sets the automatic resizing behaviour of tooltips. Default: true.
autoPositioningMargin Sets the margin between the tooltip and viewport edge before the tooltip is repositioned. Default: 0.
transitionDuration Sets the fade in duration in milliseconds when a tooltip is shown. Default: 300.
IndexItems.DataContent:
autoPositioning
          Sets the automatic repositioning behaviour of tooltips. Default: true.
        
          autoResizing
          Sets the automatic resizing behaviour of tooltips. Default: true.
        
          autoPositioningMargin
          Sets the margin between the tooltip and viewport edge before the tooltip is repositioned. Default: 0.
        
          transitionDuration
          Sets the fade in duration in milliseconds when a tooltip is shown. Default: 300.

IndexItems.Heading: Overriding Instance Settings
IndexItems.TextContent: Some tooltip settings can be overridden using opt-out CSS classes on individual tooltips. See below.

IndexItems.Heading: Override Settings Classes
IndexItems.TextContent: Classes used to override configuration settings are listed below.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
tooltip-nopadding Removes the default padding from the tooltip content area.
tooltip-noautopos Stops the tooltip from automatically positioning regardless of component settings.
tooltip-noautosize Stops the tooltip from automatically resizing regardless of component settings.
tooltip-noautohide Stops the tooltip from closing automatically on exiting events.
IndexItems.DataContent:
tooltip-nopadding
          Removes the default padding from the tooltip content area.
        
          tooltip-noautopos
          Stops the tooltip from automatically positioning regardless of component settings.
        
          tooltip-noautosize
          Stops the tooltip from automatically resizing regardless of component settings.
        
          tooltip-noautohide
          Stops the tooltip from closing automatically on exiting events.

IndexItems.Heading: Showing and Hiding Tooltips Programatically
IndexItems.TextContent: There may be cases when you need to show or hide tooltips via javascript. Static and focus type tooltips can be closed by using the Esc key if focus is on the tooltip target element.

IndexItems.Heading: Run-time Tooltip Updates
IndexItems.TextContent: Settings specified for the tooltipControl instance can be updated programatically at run-time. See the following example, which sets the autoPositioning and autoResizing settings to false. NOTE: All tooltips on this page will be affected by the change as they are all within the same scope and component instance.

IndexItems.Heading: Functions
IndexItems.TextContent: WebUI provides a single function that can be used to update the tooltip instance settings at runtime.
IndexItems.HtmlContent: update(newSettings) Updates the tooltip instance at runtime using the configuration settings.
IndexItems.DataContent:
update(newSettings)
          Updates the tooltip instance at runtime using the configuration settings.

IndexItems.Heading: Tooltip Event Callbacks
IndexItems.TextContent: There are 4 event callbacks that can be used, ui.tooltip.show.before, ui.tooltip.show.after, ui.tooltip.hide.before, and ui.tooltip.hide.after.

IndexItems.TextContent: The tags h1, h2, h3, and h4 are styled by default and will appear as follows. In the following paragraph, the text-readable class is used to increase the line height for readability and the text-dropcap class to start with a large initial letter. WebUI is a little different to most other CSS frameworks due to an emphasis on flexibility and creativity. Heading: Text Spacing
Keywords: Text Spacing Text Spacing For Readability

IndexItems.Heading: Text Spacing For Readability
IndexItems.TextContent: The following classes can be used to set the default line spacing and readability for specific text elements. These classes are best used globally or at a page level, but can be used on individual elements also. They affect only a limited set of element types. NOTE: This limitation on element types is required because the CSS line-height property can have a significant impact on the alignment and spacing of various elements and layouts. The default spacing applied to ul (unordered list) and ol (ordered list) elements can still be overidden using spacing utility classes such as the gap-vertical-* classes.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
text Increases the line-height to 1.7em. Removes hyperlink text decoration except where specific classes are used to override it.
text-readable Increases the line-height to 1.5em. Removes hyperlink text decoration except where specific classes are used to override it.
text-normal Restores the browser default line-height and hyperlink text-decoration.
IndexItems.DataContent:
text
          Increases the line-height to 1.7em. Removes hyperlink text decoration except where specific classes are used to override it.
        
          text-readable
          Increases the line-height to 1.5em. Removes hyperlink text decoration except where specific classes are used to override it.
        
          text-normal
          Restores the browser default line-height and hyperlink text-decoration.

IndexItems.Heading: Text Sizing
IndexItems.TextContent: WebUI does not define any base font size, but depends on the browser default. The following classes can be used to set different sizes relative to the browser font size or inherited font size: In order to increase or decrease the font size for the body, a container or a section for example, just add one of the above classes to it. The class text-initial can be used to override any inherited size and set it to the current browser font size.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
text-initial Font size is always set to the browser default.
text-xs Sets the font size to 0.75 times the browser font size or the inherited font size.
text-sm Sets the font size to 0.875 times the browser font size or the inherited font size.
text-md Sets the font size to 1.1 times the browser font size or the inherited font size.
text-lg Sets the font size to 1.25 times the browser font size or the inherited font size.
text-xl Sets the font size to 1.5 times the browser font size or the inherited font size.
text-mega Sets the font size to 2.5 times the browser font size or the inherited font size.

IndexItems.Heading: Upload Examples
IndexItems.TextContent: For the file upload control it is important that the label is associated with the input control by id. The upload control works in the same way as the native browser file upload, but is re-styled in such a way that single or multiple files can optionally be listed neatly with a file count at the... NOTE: The control class can be used to add the default form control style.

IndexItems.Heading: Classes
IndexItems.TextContent: The classes below are optional except the upload class which is required.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
upload Defines the upload control.
upload-icon-left Add an upload icon to the left of the file list.
upload-icon-top Add an upload icon above the file list.
upload-icon-right Add an upload icon to the right of the file list.
upload-icon-bottom Add an upload icon below the file list.
upload-icon-light Specifies that the upload icon will be light in color.
upload-icon-dark Specifies that the upload icon will be dark in color.
upload-text-center Aligns the upload control file list at the center. Default: left aligned.
upload-text-right Aligns the upload control file list to the right. Default: left aligned.

          Defines the upload control.

          Add an upload icon to the left of the file list.

          Add an upload icon above the file list.

          Add an upload icon to the right of the file list.
        
          upload-icon-bottom

          Specifies that the upload icon will be light in color.

IndexItems.Heading: Settings
IndexItems.TextContent: Javascript settings available for the upload control. By default, scrollbars are turned off and the height of the upload control will increase automatically to accomodate its content.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
scrollX Whether the upload control will always show a horizontal scrollbar.Can be true or false. Default: false
scrollY Whether the upload control will always show a vertical scrollbar.Can be true or false. Default: false
showCount Whether the upload control will display a file count total after the file list.Can be true or false. Default: true
showFiles Whether the upload control will display a list of files added to the files array.Can be true or false. Default: true

IndexItems.Heading: Classes
IndexItems.TextContent: The scroll-* classes can be used to set when a scrollbar appears and on what axis.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:

scroll-y Sets the overflow-y property to auto.
scroll-always Sets the overflow property to scroll.
scroll-x-always Sets the overflow-x property to scroll.
scroll-y-always Sets the overflow-y property to scroll.

IndexItems.Heading: Classes
IndexItems.TextContent: This is a list of various classes and descriptions related to visibility.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
hidden Sets the display style to none and removes the element from the document layout.
block Sets the display style to block.
inline-block Sets the display style to inline-block.
inline Sets the display style to inline.
invisible Sets the visibility property to hidden, keeping the element in the document layout.
visible Sets the visibility property to visible.
screen-reader Sets the specified element to be accessible to screen readers only.
overflow-hidden Sets the overflow property to hidden.
overflow-visible Sets the overflow property to visible.
faded Sets the opacity property to 0.
opaque Sets the opacity property to 1.
toggle-parent Establishes a focus toggle context for a toggle child element.
toggle-parent-hover Establishes a hover toggle context for a toggle child element.
toggle-child Defines a child element that will be show or hide based on the type of toggle parent.

IndexItems.Heading: Classes
IndexItems.TextContent: This is a list of miscellaneous classes including layers and resizing.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
layer-initial Sets the z-index of an element to auto (Default).
layer-top Sets the z-index of an element to be above all other WebUI component z-index settings.
resize Allows a resizable control to be resized on the X or Y axis.
resize-x Allows a resizable control to be resized on the X axis.
resize-y Allows a resizable control to be resized on the Y axis.

          resize
          Allows a resizable control to be resized on the X or Y axis.
        
          resize-x
          Allows a resizable control to be resized on the X axis.
        
          resize-y
          Allows a resizable control to be resized on the Y axis.

Heading: Zoom Control
Keywords: Zoom Control Zoom Example Zoom Callback functions Settings

IndexItems.Heading: Zoom Example
IndexItems.TextContent: The zoom control can be used to zoom in or out of any visible element on a specified event.

IndexItems.Heading: Zoom Callback functions
IndexItems.TextContent: The configuration settings include the ability to specify two callback functions which will be called on either a zoom in or a zoom out event. See the following example.

IndexItems.Heading: Settings
IndexItems.TextContent: Javascript settings available for the zoom control.
IndexItems.HtmlContent:
zoomFactor The amount of zoom required on the specified event. A positive integer or decimal value. Default: 1.1
trigger The type of event that will trigger the zoom effect. A string value. Can be "hover" or "focus". Default: "hover".
transitionDuration The length of time taken by the transition effect in milliseconds. Default: 300.
zoomInCallback A function that will be called when a zoom in event occurs.
zoomOutCallback A function that will be called when a zoom out event occurs.
IndexItems.DataContent:
zoomFactor
          The amount of zoom required on the specified event. A positive integer or decimal value. Default: 1.1
        
          trigger
          The type of event that will trigger the zoom effect. A string value. Can be "hover" or "focus". Default: "hover".
        
          transitionDuration
          The length of time taken by the transition effect in milliseconds. Default: 300.
        
          zoomInCallback
          A function that will be called when a zoom in event occurs.
        
          zoomOutCallback
          A function that will be called when a zoom out event occurs.
